issue.title: No provision for fill-padding when boolalpha is set

discussion.p: N4582 subclause paragraph 6 makes no provision for fill-padding in its specification of the behaviour when (str.flags() & ios_base::boolalpha) != 0.

All the other cases from num_put — int, long, etc all are covered in p1 .. p5, which describe how to align and pad the output. (Specifically, stage 3) p6 does not.
With this description:

libc++ implements this exactly.
libstdc++ and MSVC apply padding and alignment.
I think that libstdc++ and MSVC's behavior is more appropriate.
